com.github.sahasatvik.game

Interface Game<T extends Game>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of Game object implemented
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TicTacToeGame

    public interface Game<T extends Game>
    Game defines methods a class must implement in order to use the com.github.sahasatvik.game framework. Game outlines the basic behaviour of turn-based games.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Version:
    0.1.0, 11/04/2017
    Author:
    Satvik Saha

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T getCopy()
      Returns a copy of the current Game object.
      Player<T> getCurrentPlayer()
      Returns the Player who was the last to make a Move.
      Player<T> getNextPlayer()
      Returns the Player who will be the next to make a Move.
      java.util.List<Player<T>> getPlayers()
      Returns a List of Players participating in the Game.
      java.util.List<Move<T>> getValidMoves()
      Returns a List of all possible, valid Moves that can be applied on the current Game.
      boolean hasWon(Player<T> p)
      Returns true if the current Game has been won by a Player.
      boolean isOver()
      Returns true if the current Game in over.
      boolean makeMove(Move<T> m)
      Applies the given Move on the current Game.

      • isOver

        boolean isOver()
        Returns true if the current Game in over. This includes when a Player has won, the Game is drawn or there are no possible valid moves.
        Returns:
        true if the current Game is over
        Since:
        0.1.0

        Returns:

      • getCopy

        T getCopy()
        Returns a copy of the current Game object. This copy can be changed without affecting the parent Game object.
        Returns:
        the new copy of the current Game object
        Since:
        0.1.0
